title: Can i use the tax assessment value as proof of home value to do chapter 13 ,that value is 100000 less than a home analisis.
question: i will qualify to stripp the home equity according the tax assessment value
answers: Although the practice of trustees differ, certainly it would be best practice (if most expensive) to obtain an appraisal by a licensed appraiser.
You need to get the home appraised by a licensed appraiser. Even if no one objects to your motion, if you only use the assessed value, most judges will not grant the motion.

Tax assessment values are almost never set at the actual fair market value of property. You must use the fair market value of your home in the lien stripping motion.

Lien stripping motion practice differs from court to court. Some courts require full appraisals from licensed appraisers while others will accept the opinion of the home owner if the lender does not object. You should talk to an attorney in your area who has done this type of motion in the local court to see what type of valuations will be accepted in a lien strip.
